pages.text:
About Rock'n Riverwalk
Rock'n Riverwalk is downtown Stuart, FL's signature concert series presented by
Stuart Main Street
and the
Historic Stuart Downtown Business Association
. These non-profit organizations are able to host the event at no charge to the public thanks to generous sponsors, attendee donations and additional live music events that benefit Rock'n Riverwalk. To learn more visit
www.stuartmainstreet.org
or email
director@stuartmainstreet.org
.
Bring your children, pets, family and friends.
For easy parking, ride the free Sailfish Shuttle from Osceola, Sailfish or Kiwanis Park.
Rock'n Riverwalk gives back to the community
Stuart Main Street’s mission is to
create and promote a positive downtown experience for residents, businesses, and visitors. And by partnering with the Downtown Business Association, the vision for Rock'n Riverwalk continues to provide the concert series at no charge to the public and to increase the funds it raises to be able to host additional events for the public at no charge.
Support our cause today.
GET INVOLVED
Learn about other events presented by Stuart Main Street
About Downtown Stuart
Come to Downtown Stuart for Rock'n Riverwalk and stay for so much more! Downtown Stuart was voted America’s Most Beautiful City by America in
Bloom
and one of America's Happiest Seaside Towns by
Coastal Living Magazine
.
Shop, dine and experience
more than 50 locally-owned shops, restaurants and galleries in a charming Old Florida setting.
History of Rock'n Riverwalk
In 2000, Rock'n Riverwalk began as the Lunchbox Concert Series on each Friday afternoon from October through June. It was launched by City of Stuart, Stuart Main Street, the Historic Downtown Business Association and the Stuart Green Market as a seasonal event to help increase visitors to the then struggling Downtown Stuart area.
Over time, the event's popularity grew and the downtown traffic increased. The event was renamed RiverWalk Jazz Series and moved to Sundays, but remained seasonal. Stuart News joined as the presenting sponsor, helped produce and promote the shows, helped attract larger crowds and received six awards for their efforts from the
Florida Festival & Events Association
.
The Florida Inland Navigation District
also played an integral role in supporting the evolution of Rock'n Riverwalk by awarding a grant that funded the iconic sail shades that cover the Riverwalk stage. The beautiful shade structure has made the venue more comfortable for musicians and fans, especially during the hotter summer months.

Musical Acts
Musical acts interested in booking, please email an EPK along with other promotional links to Ron Hart at
cleftocodatunes@gmail.com
Sponsors & Vendors
If you are interested in sponsoring Rock’n Riverwalk or becoming a vendor, contact Candace Callahan, Executive Director for Stuart Main Street at
director@stuartmainstreet.org
